poem:
### Cop City Echoes

In the heart of Georgia,  
boundless voices collide—  
a defiant whisper sharpens,  
rights unraveling like ribbon.  
Beneath shadowed bureaucracy,  
hope clings to cracked pavements.  
Words in inked stories twist,  
curving into protest's pulse,  
and freedom's ghost drapes  
over the unyielding pine.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Georgia officials ‘blatantly violated’ rights in Cop City case, say protesters Georgia prosecutors and police have repeatedly stretched the law or come under harsh criticism for their handling of a criminal conspiracy case involving protesters against a police-training center colloquially known as “Cop City”, activists and experts say. The case has been pushed so recklessly that one of the subjects of the prosecution told the Guardian that their constitutional rights were being “blatantly violated”, after". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
